comments.commentBody:
'Lousy'? 'Lousy' because it doesn't demonstrate that men are vicious rapists?

Or maybe this is a 'good' case because it shows how often women lie about rape - and how the press goes along with it?

These 'lousy' cases happen often because incidences of 'gang rape' in fraternaties are basically non-existent.

This would only make sense if the contributions of these organizations to all political candidates and parties were disclosed. Since the SCOTUS has sanctioned unlimited secret contributions, this seems highly unlikely.

Such an incomplete and one-sided picture would be even more misleading than the current situation and drive political money further underground.

I appreciate Ruse's sincere strivings to close the gap, to conclude about God in a way that allows him, us, to move along and leave behind what he sees as an amoral if not immoral idea.   But he connects the dots of the misunderstanding and shortsightedness of too many about a true God who can be known and is different than meanly described here. He, Ruse, would not talk with me but I wish I could talk to him about the God I know. He would have us be more generous, forgiving, accepting, fierce helpers of the poor and the voiceless, enlightened stewards of this beautiful earth that is a gift for all. I would draw Ruse's same conclusions were I to look to too many who claim to be God's followers as proof of Him. But I would look differently, deeper before I would move on.

@Joe are you kidding me? These contemporary frats exist solely to engage in drunken anti- social behavior and the mistreatment of women. Don't believe me,  listen to the frat boys brag about their sexual abuse of vulnerable women. Even if a particular incident lacks the element of a crime, these characters, like the Duke Lacrosse players, who had hired poor women as strippers,, are hardly "stand up guys" in.my view.

*Difficult to be believed*

It seems that that everyone and their grandmother took what she said to be true without any skepticism at all AND THAT IS THE PROBLEM.

She can't be "fired," because she's a freelancer. And no one "charge" a journalist for a story, especially when it would be near-impossible to prove criminal intent. And in the United States, you can't disallow someone from writing things — which, in essence, is being a journalist.

What crime did she commit?

Submitting a false report to the police. And if made under oath, perjury.

Leroy - What is required to bring a successful case for slander? Do you know? Did she identify a real human being?

The journalist deserves most of the blame here. Jackie is not responsible for the public's reaction. People have to take responsibility for their own reactions to media stories. We still do not have all of the facts here in terms of Jackie's thought process and behaviors. Yet, people are jumping all over this story just as they did the initial story. Everyone just wants to express outrage, despite incomplete information provided by the media.
sherman - Are you serious?  She did not file a report with the police alleging a sexual assault.  Did you read the Rolling Stone article or even this article?  Seriously?

Some of the comments here show complete ignorance of the criminal justice system. Charge her with a crime? For what? What crime did she commit? Provide a citation in the state criminal code. She did not report a crime to police and attempt to press charges against a real human being.
Pure reactionary ignorance, just as they accuse those who initially believed the story. Whether Erdely and/or Jackie could even be civilly liable is unclear.
The story was too good to check....

Rolling Stone editors led with their hearts instead of their heads and failed to save Susan Ederly from herself. It was the boffo, socko perfect story! Why check facts to determine veracity? Did the frat have a party that night? Dunno but who cares? Did the alleged attacker really work at a venue where the victim supposedly ran into him? Dunno but who cares? Anybody who reads detective novels, much less edits newspapers, knows, or should know, how to probe a story to gauge its accuracy. But in this case, the story was just too good to be true!
Mimi, you would have made a good judge or jury member back at the Salem witch trials. Burn all frat members at the stake NOW!

Prosecuted under what state law?  Care to provide a citation?  You're aware that she did not file a police report or even identify a real human being, right?  Did you read the story or just the headline?

My goodness: "Ask yourselves, are lives really ruined by un-prosecuted accusations?" I would love to make you experience the two years of hell that the group of Duke frat members accused of raping a hired stripper went through a few years ago, expelled from the school, arrested and kept in jail until bail was made, their pictures plastered nationwide as vicious racist rapists, facing life in prison, until finally totally cleared. Naw, the "greater good" was served.

Exactly which men did she identify as her rapists? Do you have names? Who should ensure that she suffers consequences? If so, what authority (law) would allow this?

This is a typical reactionary comment and representative of the electorate. This outrage without any consideration of reality is what drives our public policies.

Why the incessant need to continually mistake mass media for "news". The mass media is in the entertainment business not the news business.

Whether the woman was raped or not is no matter to RS nor any other newspaper. Neither is the justification of the punishment to the fraternities and university - they are simple collateral damage in the quest to entertain and sell more copies.

I don't think accusation means what you think it means. To charge someone for falsely reporting a crime requires that the person actually report a crime. You're aware that she did not report a crime against a real human being and attempt to press charges, correct?

The reporter had an agenda and was hunting the campus for anyone who would support what she wanted to write. You're aware that regardless of what the girl initially told the reporter, she attempted to withdraw her story, right?

I agree with AJ.  What crime did she commit, Mr. Prosecutor?  Care to provide a citation with each element of the crime?  I was not not aware that "character assassination" is a criminal offense.  Please enlighten us.
More like classifying mafia members as dangerous maybe.

How were they out lawyered?  It is the DA's job to make the case for the people (crime victims).  Women have to buck up and come forward if they've been raped, demand that rape kits be completed and used at trial, and demand that the police take rape cases seriously, otherwise rape remains a whispering campaign that traumatizes true rape victims and emboldens liars such as Jackie.
What is "felony mischief?"  Can you provide a citation for me with each element and apply it to the facts of this case?

"Why should they be ostracized for crimes of which they were found innocent"?

The likelyhood that they will be (in numerous) ways ostracized, discriminated against, penalized, etc. is very high as it is supported by statistically significant evidence in real life.

Homo sapiens - and females of Homo sapiens in statistically significantly higher degree than males of Homo sapiens - due to "Gift of Fear" propaganda and evolutionary fact that they are more prone to be "alert" and "aware of" possible danger - are far from being rational and fair and unbiased and "there must been something on that" (false accusation) ... so I better a) do not hire such person b) deny him opportunity for advancement he seeks ... in 99% of real life situations with "clean hands" and any risk of being blamed or charged with acting in biased or prejudicial way.

Besides: Your argument that victim of rape might often find not to have any or not enough of admissible evidence in support of his or her assertion doesn't sound right. Rape is a very gross violation of human body and psyche and there always is plenty of physical and other evidence.

You, on one hand, assert that being found "not guilty" of rape is just fine, w/o any subsequent damages due to false (or unproven) allegation of rape ...

... yet at the same time you say that any prosecution and punishment of a false accuser would discourage victims to report the crime of rape. So thye court has to find for victim ALL the time, otherwise ...?

Let’s not sit here and pretend that fraternities were humble dwellings houses full of paragons of human existence.  The reason this story took off the way it did is because people have no trouble believing that frats could be involved in something like this.  Fraternities have a huge image problem with lots of documented incidents to back it up.  Regardless of the truths involved in Jackie’s story, perhaps it would be in fraternities best interest to ask what their real purpose on campus is, what are the character requirements that should be asked of its members, and what are the kinds of steps they need to take to restore their credibility in the public eye?  The new rules put in place after this incident are a step in the right direction, and hopefully they will led to safer college experience.  And if fraternities want to exist on campus decades from now they may want to go along with the new rules.

This is not the first time the same reporter has written a story about a rape that has not been substantiated. It is the second time.

If she is ever allowed to report again, I hope that all her stories get the greatest possible scrutiny before being allowed to see the light of day.
Laura - I think a lot of people here think she should be charged with lying to a journalist.  I mean, that's a criminal offense under Virginia law, right?

This is a political issue, though.
The left and leftist leaders in no small measure created scenarios like these with their "war on women" falsehoods.
The left DOES demonize men. The left does seem to believe that women are the only victims and men are the only perpetrators of sexual assault, of domestic abuse, or of bad behavior of any sort.
If "progressives" did in fact get beyond their obsession with identity politics, their often worthy causes would find much more support, and Mich more success.

Why NOT making this - all too typical false rape accusation + parasiting of mainstream media + "activists" on such blatant falsehood - a political issue?

These are not insulated cases and their number are - in this PC, political and mainstream media environment - growing in numbers, product of such environment.

Another narrative-driven story falls apart upon examination. Did anyone read the original story and not think "that doesn't sound right?"
The big question is why are supposed journalists so gullible when it comes to certain perpetrators. The same media that will interview Jeb Bush's high school classmates from 40 years ago won't do cursory background checks on an incident that allegedly happened 3 years ago? Please. Kudos to those who looked at this story with the skepticism it deserved, especially the Washington Post. I can only imagine the pressure to go with the flow: "C'mon, it's is a fraternity we are talking about, whose side are you on?"
